title: Dow up 280 points on gains for UnitedHealth, JPMorgan Chase stocks
text:
The Dow Jones Industrial Average is rallying Tuesday morning with shares of UnitedHealth and JPMorgan Chase leading the way for the index. The Dow DJIA, +1.14% was most recently trading 280 points higher (1.1%), as shares of UnitedHealth UNH, +8.58% and JPMorgan Chase JPM, +3.74% are contributing to the index's intraday rally. UnitedHealth's shares have climbed $18.29 (8.3%) while those of JPMorgan Chase have gained $3.42, or 2.9%, combining for a roughly 147-point bump for the Dow. Other components contributing significantly to the gain include Johnson & Johnson JNJ, +2.03%, Caterpillar CAT, +2.01%, and Intel INTC, +2.13%. A $1 move in any of the benchmark's 30 components results in a 6.78-point swing.

Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
